tool.name: docker scriptrunner
tool.command: python "$__tool_directory__/scriptrunner.py" --script_path "$runme" --interpreter "$interpreter" --user_email "$__user_email__" #if $generate_simple_output.make_TAB=="yes": --output_tab "$tab_file" #end if #if $make_HTML.value=="yes": --output_dir "$html_file.files_path" --output_html "$html_file" --make_HTML "yes" #else: --output_dir "." #end if #if $additional_parameters != 'None': #for i in $additional_parameters: --additional_parameters "$i.param_name, $i.param_value" #end for #end if #if $input_files != 'None': --input_tab #for i in $input_files: $i.input #end for #for i in $input_files: --input_format "Any" #end for #end if --docker_image "$docker_image"

param.name: input
param.label: Select an input file from your history
param.help: Most scripts will need an input - your script MUST be ready for whatever format you choose

param.name: make_HTML
param.label: Create an HTML report with links to all output files and thumbnail links to PDF images
param.help: Recommended for presenting complex outputs in an accessible manner. Turn off for simple tools so they just create one output
param.option: Yes, arrange all outputs produced by my script as an HTML output
No, no HTML output file thanks

param.name: make_TAB
param.label: Create a new history output alongside the HTML file specified above
param.help: This is useful if your script creates a single new tabular file you want to appear in the history after the tool executes
param.option: My script writes to a new history output
I do not want a new history output file

param.name: out_format
param.label: Select the datatype that your tool/script produces
param.help: If your datatype is not listed here, it has to be added in galaxy's datatypes_conf.xml

param.name: interpreter
param.label: Select the interpreter for your code

param.help: The script you are pasting will be run in this image. Make sure it contains the necessary tools
param.label: Select a docker image
param.name: docker_image
dynScript
param.label: Copy and paste the script to be executed here
param.help: Script must deal with two command line parameters: Path to input tabular file path (or 'None' if none selected) and path to output tabular history file (or 'None').
